1.content:
...A tree fell across the path, barely missing me. I found myself gasping for breath as I wiped the cold sweat from my brow. The path was blocked thoroughly and there was no way to get around it without a good chain saw, or straying from the path quite a bit.

"A tree fell, and no one was there to hear it..."

I could go back but I was already deep into the woods, besides, I should be able to cut through the woods a bit and find the path further on...

It seemed like the vegetation was different somehow. It even seemed as if the seasons had suddenly changed and it was now closer to Autumn. A falling leaf and a chill wind certainly didn't help this early in the year! Looking back along the path once I got on it once again, I saw a chain across the path and a "NO Trespassing" sign posted for all to see. This was not there before! This was public land! This was the Manistee Public Forest. I must be on the wrong path.

Further ahead, there was an old looking log cabin that was definitely not on the path I was familiar with. My heart was racing a bit. It can't hurt to knock on the door?

From the falling down shape of the cabin, I was surprised to get an answer. Surprisingly, from inside the door stood a stately gentleman I did not recognize. He seemed to recognize me, though...(HE said)
1.title: Crack!

info.brief_description: A story in which the readers are invited to carry on with the story
info.description: I was walking in the forest, listening to nature music, when................
